Coconuts on the Beach Finding time to get away from the hustle and bustle of life to enjoy a well-earned getaway is important. Taking a moment to simply embrace the best that life has to offer is essential when it comes to finding a sense of well-being and balance. Travelers looking for a place where they can unwind in coastal style will quickly discover that Cocoa Beach, Florida has everything they‚Äôve been looking for! From sugar-white sands and sun to endless surf, Cocoa Beach is a place to indulge the senses. It‚Äôs also an oasis of flavor waiting to be found! Visitors in the mood to make the most of an authentic beach bar and restaurant experience while they‚Äôre in town will want to make sure to enjoy a meal at Coconuts on the Beach restaurant while they‚Äôre here. Enjoy the Best of Beachside Flavor and Style at the Coconuts on the Beach Restaurant Coconuts on the Beach in Cocoa Beach is found at 2 Minutemen Causeway and is open to the dining public daily from 11:00 am until 10:00 pm. This laid-back beach hangout and eatery is easy to spot thanks to its vibrant fa√ßade and inspiring location near the water. While guests enjoying a meal at Coconuts on the Beach in Cocoa Beach can always dine indoors, it‚Äôs the sprawling patio overlooking the sand and water complete with tiki huts that draws the most attention. Just steps from the sand, this restaurant provides patrons with amazing views, and plenty of menu items to match! Coconuts on the Beach is also known and loved for its regular lineup of live music performances, amazing, handcrafted cocktails, and friendly service to top it all off. Menu Highlights Every stop at Coconuts on the Beach promises to be a treat for the tastebuds. Guests will want to start things off by ordering up appetizers for the table. Selections include options like poke nachos, bangin‚Äô shrimp, coconut crusted shrimp, and island conch fritters too! Fresh soup and salad are available for those dining light with burgers and sandwiches readily available when a more robust dining experience is in order. Entr√©e selections at Coconuts on the Beach include fresh catch of the day as well as stuffed red snapper, jalapeno crusted mahi and lemon caper salmon. Whether you go with a lobster dinner or shrimps and scallops, it‚Äôs bound to be a palate-pleasing experience. Coconuts on the Beach has a full kid‚Äôs menu available as well as dessert options that include pineapple cr√®me brulee and three-layer chocolate cake. Savor the Cocoa Beach Moment The next time travel plans bring you to Cocoa Beach, the team at Happy Palm Stays is here to make sure you have the luxurious vacation rental you deserve in place! Get in touch today to learn more and to start planning. LUCIA Perfectly placed closest to the treasures of Saint Lucia, Coconut Bay offers guests many opportunities to behold the beauty of our legendary island. Above and below the seas, awe-inspiring scenes await. Visit the Adventure Saint Lucia desk (located in the resort lobby) to make your reservations for island excursions from SCUBA diving, snorkeling, deep sea fishing and sunset cruises to a jeep safari through the rainforest, horseback riding or ATV rides. Tours & Excursions Land Tours Sea Tours Thrilling Excursions Groups Wellness Spa Image Spa Copy SANCTUARY SPA Treat yourself to pure indulgence in the spa at Coconut Bay. This eight-room oasis offers the sounds of the ocean to soothe the senses while relaxing the body and mind. Guests can choose from a variety of treatments including signature organic therapies in oceanview treatment rooms featuring outdoor showers. Whether your desire is to soothe or rejuvenate the skin, our treatments and staff aim to please. Pick your own aloe stem, enjoy a massage for two outdoors, or just close your eyes and allow your mind to be renewed. We invite you to experience true pampering in paradise. SANCTUARY SPA Spa Services Spa Brochure More Gallery Image Gallery Copy EXPERIENCE Our island offers an enticing mix of Caribbean beaches, tropical blue waters filled with reefs, lush rainforests, and an interesting history. Visitors will find a seemingly endless array of activities within the island‚Äôs unparalleled natural attractions. About Us ‚Äì The Coconut People Skip to content Home Shop Now Organic Virgin Coconut Oil Organic Coconut Sugar Face Care Face Scrubs Lip Balms The Lifestyle Collection Coconut Soap Holder Coconut Wood Spoon Coconut Candles Bamboo Toothbrush Coconut Bowls Coconut-Coir Dish Scrubber Combo Kits Blog About Us Contact Us Privacy Policy Return & Refund Policy Terms of Use Blog About Us Contact Us Shipping and Delivery Account Cart FREE & FAST SHIPPING Your cart is empty ü•• 10% OFF ON YOUR FIRST ORDER ü•• Home Home Shop Now Organic Virgin Coconut Oil Organic Coconut Sugar Face Care Face Scrubs Lip Balms The Lifestyle Collection Coconut Soap Holder Coconut Wood Spoon Coconut Candles Bamboo Toothbrush Coconut Bowls Coconut-Coir Dish Scrubber Combo Kits Blog Blog About Us About Us Contact Us Contact Us About Us Why We Can‚Äôt Stop Being Coco-Nuts! Coconuts were always a big part of our tropical, Southern-Indian upbringing and¬†we just had to¬†bring its awesome-ness to everyone. It's a wonderful thing to be able to imbibe the best of different cultures around the world, and this is our eco-good contribution to the broader lives we've begun to lead. Our obsession with coconuts has also got a lot to do with their incredible versatility, sustainability and nurturing abilities. Born in tropical coastal lands and imbued with the labour of love by local plantation owners, this wonderful tree promises a sustainable and cleaner way of living.¬†And that's what we are all about! It is the best instance of nature serving nature and we wanted to share this spirit with the whole world. Lovingly Called ‚ÄúThe Tree Of Life‚Äù Around The World For centuries, people have explored various aspects of the coconut tree and the nutritional benefits it holds. Through this search have come some groundbreaking discoveries and remedies for wellness. Every fiber of its existence adds to life in some way or the other. Celebrated in cultures & traditions all-over the globe and even worshipped in many religions that have experienced its benefits, it has been rightly dubbed as "Kalpavriksham" or ‚ÄúThe Tree Of Life‚Äù. Potent Ingredients Sourced From Nature's Lap Our carefully-curated ingredients and potent formulations provide blanket coverage to fulfil your skin's beauty and wellness needs. Often peppered with our humble coconut, our products will keep your wellness game strong. Coconuts In, Toxins Out. We Are Doing Beauty Better. All our products are carefully & scientifically formulated to make the most out of our all-time favourite coconut and nature's best ingredients. We are constantly in touch with our producers to ensure that rigorous standards are followed through, so that we get the choicest ingredients to cater to your skin's multiple needs and infuse it with nutrients that will keep it glowing and healthy. Environment First. We were one of the first companies in India to go plastic-free because we love the environment just as much as we love you. We love if something can be re-used or re-purposed effectively! The ideal example for this would be our glass jars, which can be easily up-cycled as part of your home d√©cor, used to grow cute succulents for your work desk or store spices in your kitchen. We pack our products with bio-degradable, re-cyclable or re-usable packaging to ensure they don't end up as pollutants in landfills. We take sustainability all the way! Vocal For Local There is just something about knowing that what you are¬†using is sourced, produced, assembled and made locally by people you can identify with. We believe in locally-grown, sourced and made products. This is why we have long-established ties with our producers and plantation owners, who never compromise on the quality of products and are an essential part of our Coco-family. Safeguarding Our Furry and Feathered Friends None of our products are tested on animals because we love our furry and feathered friends! All our products are made without putting any animal life in danger or harm. Welcome to our family. Meet the nutty folks! The Coconut People are wanderers, with their roots set firmly in the tropical estates of southern India - from Kerala to the Andamans.¬†We‚Äôve lived our lives in the coconut-rich fields of India‚Äôs coasts - and life here is different. Organic living is not a trend here, it‚Äôs a lifestyle. It permeates into each day of our existence - from edibles, oils, skin applicants, to even utensils! Each coconut here is grown naturally and organically, without chemical or synthetic fertilizers. Published on December 28, 2022 By Robert Burns Facebook Twitter Linkedin ReddIt Tumblr Telegram - Advertisement - The company made the following announcement on their Facebook page today. - Advertisement - On Friday, December 23rd, we lost our George Artz. He was the owner, creator and visionary of our iconic oceanfront establishment. It was started as a dream of his in the 70‚Äôs, and it‚Äôs because of him and his endless dedication, creativity, and hard work, that Coconuts on the Beach has turned into a world famous destination in the wonderful little town of Cocoa Beach, Fl. Many of the people who visit Coconuts on the regular are lifelong friends of George and his tight knit family whom he loved so dearly. His legacy will carry on through the hard work of his children and his dedicated employees, who were also like family to him. George was an incredibly special man, and if you were lucky enough to know him, well, you were lucky enough. Fly high, George, and rest easy. Thank you for all that you‚Äôve accomplished! - Advertisement - Upcoming Events Upcoming Events Sep 12 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm Triggered Comedy Club featuring Preach Carter Sep 13 11:30 am - 2:30 pm Politics, Religion, and Society: A Panel Discussion and Luncheon Sep 26 7:30 pm - 9:00 pm Triggered Comedy Club featuring Clyde Gordon View Calendar Facebook Posts The Space Coast Rocket 5 days ago What's your take? See More See Less Photo View on Facebook ¬∑ Share Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Linked In Share by Email The Space Coast Rocket 6 days ago üö® Flagler Fugitive Accused of Sexually Battering Child Under 12 Returned to Florida üö® After weeks of delays and legal wrangling in North Carolina, 72-year-old Kermit Booth‚Äîwanted on two counts of sexual battery on a child under 12‚Äîis now back in Florida custody. Flagler County Sheriff Rick Staly and his team personally traveled to North Carolina to bring Booth back after his second arrest on a governor‚Äôs warrant. He‚Äôs now being held at the Sheriff Perry Hall Detention Facility on $500,000 bond and faces life in prison if convicted. Sheriff Staly didn‚Äôt mince words: ‚ÄúI hope he enjoyed his flight back to Florida because it‚Äôll probably be the last flight he takes. Hopefully, he‚Äôll be spending the rest of his life in prison.‚Äù Booth‚Äôs case stretches back nearly two decades, with allegations dating between 2006‚Äì2009 when the victim was just 6 to 9 years old. The victim bravely came forward again in 2023, allowing investigators to relaunch the case and uncover new evidence. Sheriff Staly thanked Governor Ron DeSantis, NC Governor Roy Cooper, Macon County Sheriff Holbrooks, and Florida Commissioner of Agriculture Wilton Simpson for their roles in making this extradition possible. Booth‚Äôs return marks the beginning of what Sheriff Staly says will hopefully be long-overdue justice for the victim. ... Meet Our Team - Pensacola Country Club Drop Down Navigation Home About Our Club Club History Meet Our Team Contact Club Amenities Golf Golf Course Golf Instruction Meet Our Team Annual Calendar LGA Tennis Tennis Facility Meet Our Team Dining Menus Youth Aquatics Fitness Membership Wedding & Events Guest Information Menu Home About Our Club Club History Meet Our Team Contact Club Amenities Golf Golf Course Golf Instruction Meet Our Team Annual Calendar LGA Tennis Tennis Facility Meet Our Team Dining Menus Youth Aquatics Fitness Membership Wedding & Events Guest Information Member Login HTML Generator Meet Our Team Side Navigation Our Club Club History Meet Our Team Contact Our Club Club History Meet Our Team Contact Meet Our Team Meet Your Team Maggie Bleau, Director of Membership & Marketing Maggie Bleau joined Pensacola Country Club¬†as the Director of Membership & Marketing in December 2024. From Maggie: "I started my career in hospitality and the Marriott brand, from there I moved into private clubs at the Union League Club of Chicago as a Business Development Manager just about a decade ago.¬† It was in this role that I began to craft my skill set. The General Manager trained me to understand what it is to belong to a private club to sell memberships. For ninety days he had me mirror members, have conversations with every department head and many members, learn the storytelling, and know the history of the ULCC. I did regular tours of the clubhouse with the Director of the Art Collection to learn the artists and works we had. I could speak to every corner of the clubhouse. It was in this position that I knew I wanted to be more than a manager. I am a passionate leader that thrives on connecting people. I have successfully reopened an athletic club after a three-year delay in renovations; I have learned how to gracefully sell a club with two campuses and golf at two different country clubs. I am eager to meet you all and grow and engage the membership." Contact Maggie at [email¬†protected] . Chris¬†McCullar, Director¬†of Racquets Chris¬†McCullar¬†is currently serving in his 20th¬†year as the Director of Tennis at Pensacola Country Club. He has great passion for all of the programs offered at Pensacola Country Club, with Junior programming always being extremely active. Before his time in Pensacola, Chris was the Director of Tennis at The Club at Rock Creek in¬†Fairhope, AL, where he developed the junior program into one of the best in the state. Chris attended Rhodes College in Memphis, TN, where he received his Bachelor of Arts and played #1 singles and doubles for three of his four collegiate years. He is also a formerly nationally ranked junior player, and formerly ranked #1 in the state of Alabama. Chris has a wife, Wendy and three children, Will, Max and Jackson. Contact Chris at [email¬†protected] . Jennifer Naar, Events Coordinator Jennifer Naar is a Pensacola native and has served our Membership on our F&B Team since 2019. Having owned her own wedding planning and event details business since 2010, Jennifer has used her creativity and drive to help make each event memorable for all in attendance and has been a part of thousands of events locally over the last decade. She is excited to be the Events Coordinator at PCC and looks forward to putting on many beautiful and successful events. Contact Jennifer at [email¬†protected] . Andrew Boston, Director of Golf Andrew joined the Pensacola Country Club staff in April of 2023 as the Director of Golf. Andrew attended high school in State College, Pennsylvania before graduating from the Professional Golf Management Program at Coastal Carolina University. Since graduating, he has spent time working at facilities such as Cherry Hills Country Club, Sea Island Golf Club, Ocean Forest Golf Club and, most recently, as the Head Golf Professional at the Old Town Club in Winston-Salem, North Carolina. He and his wife, Danielle, a former golf professional herself, have a son, Archer. They enjoy spending time exploring new restaurants, visiting the beach and playing golf together. Contact Andrew at [email¬†protected] . Alex Marshall, Director of¬†Greens & Grounds Alex joined the Pensacola Country Club team in December of 2023 as the Director of Greens & Grounds. Alex is a native of the Mississippi coast where he graduated high school. After a junior college baseball stint, Alex received his Bachelor of Science degree with a concentration in Golf and Sports Turf Management from Mississippi State University. Alex interned at facilities such as Fallen Oak, Old Waverly, and The Preserve Golf Club while getting his degree. Upon graduating, Alex spent 2016-2022 as an assistant superintendent at Old Overton Club. Alex and his wife, Taylor, moved to Gulf Breeze in January of 2022 for Alex to pursue the Superintendent role at Tiger Point Golf Club. Alex and Taylor have a daughter, Holly, who enjoys time at the beach, zoo, and long walks with her spaniels. Contact Alex at [email¬†protected] . Bill Hewett, Executive Chef Chef Bill Hewett joined the Pensacola Country Club team in June 2024 relocating from Naples, Florida¬†where he worked as Chef de Cuisine at Grey Oaks Country Club and Executive Chef at Cedar Hammock Golf and Country Club. He is a member of the American Culinary Federation and has over 25 years of culinary experience. After graduating from Johnson and Wales with a Degree in Culinary arts, he moved to Atlanta, Georgia where his past work experience included Cherokee Town and Country Club, Executive Chef at Augusta Country Club, Chef/Owner of Atlanta Culinary Concepts and Chef Instructor at Art Institute of Atlanta and Le Cordon Bleu, where he taught a variety of classes including cooking fundamentals, garde manger, international cuisines, American regional, catering and buffet courses. Bill is excited about joining the PCC team and looks forward to having a positive impact on the Culinary Program. Contact Chef Bill at [email¬†protected] . Audrey¬†Davida¬†Thompson, Youth Director | Pool & Cabana Manager Audrey began working at Pensacola Country Club as the Assistant Pool & Cabana Manager in Spring of 2013, taking on the role of Youth Director in the fall of 2015. With more than 30 years of experience in the service industry and an equal number of years' experience working with children on a personal and a volunteer level, Audrey has involved herself with programs including the Junior Chamber of Commerce, CASA, Underprivileged Children's Christmas Charities, Farley Community Church VBS, and the Ronald McDonald House Charities. Audrey makes it a personal commitment to ensure that every child that comes to the Club has an enjoyable and memorable experience, and she takes great pride in watching our Club‚Äôs youth grow and flourish through these experiences. Audrey has four grown boys aged 36, 34, 32 and 25, and has one grandson whom she adores. For enjoyment, Audrey spends time on the water kayaking and sailing, learning to speak French, as well as exploring Pensacola on her bicycle. Contact Audrey at [email¬†protected] . Jennifer Jens, BeachLIFE Fitness Coordinator Jennifer Jens is the owner and coordinator of BeachLIFE Fitness. Jennifer and her BeachLIFE Fitness team have tought fitness classes at Pensacola Country Club for almost a year with programs tailored to an array of interests and age groups.¬†Jennifer received her BS in¬†Exercise Science from Gonzaga University. She has recieved¬†certifications in the following:¬†ACSM Certified Personal Trainer; AFAA & NASM Group Fitness; YogaFit Hatha Yoga Instructor; Spinning Certified; Certified Children‚Äôs Coach; Registered DoD Contractor. Jennifer is now a Mom of 2 and US Airforce Wife with18 Years of Experience in Health and Fitness Industry. Contact Jenn at [email¬†protected] . Josie Ynfante, Communications Director Josie¬†is a Pensacola native who began working at Pensacola Country Club in 2018 on the Food & Beverage team while attending¬†the University of West Florida for Marketing & Communications. She¬†has since worked in various departments around the club from the pool, to the tennis center, to the front desk and more, gaining an understanding of all aspects of the club. Before coming¬†back¬†full time to serve as Communications Director in 2022, Josie also worked with the Studer Family of Companies.¬†Josie is passionate about solving problems and developing creative and informative content to keep members and staff well-informed. In her free time, Josie enjoys spending time with her pets and husband, doing outdoor activities, and making art. Contact Josie at [email¬†protected] . Mark Cooper, Building Superintendent Mark Cooper joined the Pensacola Country Club team in 2014 and has over 50 years of experience in the maintenance field, with a background in Electrical and AC maintenance. He worked in the building maintenance department at The Veranda of Pensacola and as a maintenance supervisor for local property managers. Mark retired from General Motors with 34 years of seniority in 2009 as a Job Setter/ Team Leader. He moved from the Ann Arbor / Detroit area to Pensacola in 2011 and resides in Milton with his wife, Teresa, and their spoiled pets. Contact Mark at [email¬†protected] . Chance Caylor, Lead Assistant Superintendent ÔªøChance joined PCC as the Lead Assistant Superintendent in 2024 after starting his career at Ross Bridge of the Robert Trent Jones Golf Trail. He is an Auburn, Alabama native and supports anything involving the Auburn Tigers. Chance graduated from the University of West Alabama, and was a four-year letterman on the golf team. When he‚Äôs not on the golf course, whether working or playing, Chance and his wife, Devin, enjoy spending time with their dogs, cooking new foods, and being with friends. Lucas Pedrotti, Assistant Tennis Pro Lucas is originally from Caxias do Sul, Brazil where he was ranked the #1 player in his state and a top 20 player nationally. He came to the United States to play at Bloomberg University in Pennsylvania where he played 2 years at #1 singles and doubles and earned first team PSAC Conference Honors. He finished his playing career at the University of West Florida where he earned his degree in Finance in 2021. Lucas began his coaching career in 2016 in Brazil where he worked with low-income children teaching the game of tennis. He has worked locally at both the RG Tennis Academy in Pensacola and most recently at Shoreline Tennis Center in Gulf Breeze. Lucas brings an infectious positivity to his tennis instruction, and we are very excited about him being a member of our team. PENSACOLA COUNTRY CLUB 1500 Bayshore Drive,
												Pensacola, Florida 32507 Contact (850) 455-7364 [email¬†protected] Follow Us Copyright ¬© Pensacola Country Club All Rights Reserved. Powered by Northstar Technologies Member Login
